title: how can I boot a compressed ntfs partition from usb

forumNotes.author: Zoso
forumNotes.content:
Hi everyone,  

I am learning to use ImDisk and have ram booted a compressed ntfs .ima so I tried to compress the ntfs file system on my usb hdd and boot xp w/usboot as normal but got the error message "NTLDR is compressed"  

so Im wondering if I can uncompress only the NTLDR to save space on the usb boot drive and/or if there are other files that must also be uncompressed too?  

thanks

forumNotes.author: joakim
forumNotes.content:
> I am learning to use ImDisk and have ram booted a compressed ntfs .ima so I tried to compress the ntfs file system on my usb hdd and boot xp w/usboot as normal but got the error message "NTLDR is compressed"  
>
> so Im wondering if I can uncompress only the NTLDR to save space on the usb boot drive and/or if there are other files that must also be uncompressed too?  
Should be enough to uncompress only ntldr.

forumNotes.author: Zoso
forumNotes.content: Yes, it was. after your mention I did that and uncompressed only NTLDR and now it will boot. thanks
